page.title: 03An archaeological dig
page.content: { Tea breaks}were a welcome chance to gather at the tea tent, ease aching muscles and discuss the latest finds and their significance. The{"Finds" caravan}was a fascinating place where a jumble of fragments would grow into a carefully glued together pot.How much more impressive the restored object was than its scattered fragments. Many{Roman finds}were made including numerous{coins,}some very corroded but others with their inscriptions still clearly legible. Another interesting find was an{iron {overshoe}that Roman horses are believed to have worn in our muddy conditions. Altogether the dig was a fascinating project which raised considerable local interest and drew in many local volunteer helpers. Mr.Peter Cutts.
